definitions: relating to or using both sound and visual components for communication or entertainment
examples: The teacher used audiovisual aids to explain the concept
Modern classrooms are equipped with audiovisual technology

definitions: connected with the sense of hearing or the process of perceiving sound
examples: The patient showed signs of auditory processing disorder
Musicians often have superior auditory discrimination skills

definitions: increased in size, value, or effectiveness by adding something to it
examples: The company uses augmented reality in their training programs
His salary was augmented with performance bonuses

definitions: relating to the ear or the sense of hearing and sound perception
examples: The musician had excellent aural skills for identifying notes
Language learning requires both visual and aural practice

definitions: showing signs that success or good fortune is likely in the future
examples: The sunny weather was an auspicious start to their wedding
The company launched during an auspicious time in the market

definitions: having a plain and unadorned appearance with no comfort or luxury
severe or strict in manner, attitude, or appearance without warmth
examples: The monastery had an austere interior with bare walls
The room's austere furnishings reflected minimalist design
His austere demeanor intimidated the new employees
The school maintained austere disciplinary policies

definitions: being exactly as claimed or presented without falsification or imitation
examples: The museum displayed authentic artifacts from ancient Egypt
She appreciated his authentic personality and honest approach

definitions: verified as genuine or valid through official confirmation or evidence
examples: The painting was authenticated by several art experts
Users must log in with authenticated credentials

definitions: connected with or characteristic of an author's writing style or perspective
examples: The novel contains clear authorial commentary on social issues
Critics analyzed the authorial voice throughout the manuscript

definitions: given official permission or approval to do something or exist
examples: Only authorised personnel can enter the restricted area
The bank requires authorised signatures on all documents

definitions: favoring complete obedience to authority at the expense of personal freedom
examples: The country suffered under an authoritarian government regime
His authoritarian parenting style left little room for discussion

definitions: showing confident control and the expectation of being obeyed or believed
recognized as accurate and reliable because of expertise or official status
examples: She spoke in an authoritative tone during the meeting
The professor's authoritative presence commanded students' attention
The journal published authoritative research on climate change
This book is the authoritative guide on constitutional law

definitions: given official permission or approval to do something or exist
examples: Only authorized dealers can sell these products legally
The manager authorized overtime pay for the project

definitions: relating to or affected by autism spectrum disorder affecting social interaction
examples: The school provides specialized support for autistic children
Many autistic individuals have exceptional skills in specific areas

definitions: relating to or containing elements from the author's own life experiences
examples: Her novel included many autobiographical elements from childhood
The filmmaker created an autobiographical documentary about her journey

definitions: relating to a ruler who has absolute power and makes decisions alone
examples: The CEO's autocratic management style discouraged employee input
The autocratic leader refused to delegate any authority

definitions: bearing a handwritten signature, typically of a famous person or creator
examples: She treasured her autographed copy of the novel
The baseball player autographed hundreds of cards for fans

definitions: relating to disease where the immune system mistakenly attacks healthy body tissue
examples: Lupus is a serious autoimmune disease affecting multiple organs
Researchers are studying new treatments for autoimmune conditions

definitions: converted to operate automatically with minimal human intervention using technology
examples: The factory uses automated assembly lines for production
Customers appreciate the automated billing system's convenience

definitions: connected with motor vehicles, especially cars, and their design or manufacture
examples: He studied automotive engineering at the technical college
The city has a thriving automotive industry

definitions: having the freedom to act independently and make decisions without outside control
examples: The region became an autonomous territory with self-governance
Universities traditionally operate as autonomous institutions

definitions: characteristic of or occurring in autumn with its typical weather and appearance
examples: The trees displayed beautiful autumnal colors of red and gold
The cool autumnal breeze signaled the changing season

definitions: providing supplementary or additional help and support to main activities
examples: The hospital relies on auxiliary staff during emergencies
Ships carry auxiliary engines in case of main engine failure

definitions: having inflicted harm in return for injury or wrong done to oneself
examples: The hero avenged his father's death in the story
She felt avenged after winning the court case

definitions: having a strong dislike or opposition to something and wishing to avoid it
examples: She was averse to taking unnecessary risks with investments
Many people are averse to public speaking

definitions: connected with or characteristic of birds as a biological class
examples: Scientists study avian migration patterns across continents
The veterinarian specialized in avian medicine

definitions: showing great enthusiasm and keen interest in a particular activity or subject
examples: She's an avid reader who finishes several books weekly
The avid collectors searched everywhere for rare stamps

definitions: capable of being prevented or kept away from through careful action
examples: Most accidents at work are completely avoidable
The conflict was avoidable with better communication

definitions: openly acknowledged or declared without attempt to hide or disguise
examples: He was an avowed supporter of environmental causes
The candidate's avowed goal was healthcare reform

definitions: waited for with expectation or looked forward to happening
examples: The long awaited sequel finally premiered in theaters
Her awaited arrival brought relief to worried relatives

definitions: brought out of sleep or a sleeplike state into consciousness
made conscious or aware of something previously unrecognized or dormant
examples: The loud noise awakened everyone in the house
She was awakened by the morning sunlight
The documentary awakened public interest in the issue
His travels awakened a desire to help others

definitions: covered or flooded with water moving over the surface
having too much of something to the point of being overwhelmed
examples: The deck was awash with seawater during the storm
The beach rocks were awash at high tide
The market is awash with cheap imported goods
Her desk was awash with unfinished paperwork

definitions: absent without official leave from military duty or other obligation
examples: The soldier went awol and faced serious consequences
Several employees were awol after the holiday weekend

definitions: away from the intended course or twisted to one side improperly
examples: Their vacation plans went awry due to bad weather
His tie was awry after the rushed morning

definitions: having the bright blue color of a cloudless sky on a clear day
examples: The Mediterranean Sea was a brilliant azure under the sun
She wore an azure dress that matched her eyes

definitions: given support or strengthened from behind either physically or with resources
examples: The venture was backed by several major investors
The chair had a high backed design for comfort

definitions: done with the back of the hand facing forward in sports movements
examples: Her backhand tennis stroke was particularly powerful
The player scored with a brilliant backhand shot

definitions: located in or relating to the area behind the stage in a theater
examples: The actors prepared in the backstage dressing rooms
She got exclusive backstage access to meet the band

definitions: directed or moving toward the back or in reverse direction
behind in development or progress compared to what is normal or expected
examples: He took a backward glance before leaving
The car rolled backward down the steep hill
The country's backward economy needed major reforms
Some consider these views backward and outdated

definitions: connected with or caused by bacteria as single-celled microorganisms
examples: The doctor prescribed antibiotics for the bacterial infection
Scientists study bacterial growth in laboratory conditions

definitions: totally confused or perplexed and unable to understand something
examples: The detective was baffled by the mysterious disappearance
Students looked baffled by the complex equation

definitions: causing complete confusion or puzzlement that prevents understanding
examples: The case presented baffling contradictions in evidence
His baffling behavior worried his friends

definitions: hanging loosely because of being too big or having excess material
examples: He preferred baggy jeans for comfortable skateboarding
The baggy sweater hid her figure completely

definitions: cooked by dry heat in an oven until firm or crispy
examples: The freshly baked bread filled the kitchen with aroma
She served baked potatoes with the meal

definitions: uncomfortably hot in temperature, especially describing weather or climate conditions
examples: The baking desert heat made travel dangerous during midday
We stayed indoors during the baking summer afternoon

definitions: arranged in equal or correct proportions to maintain stability
considering all sides fairly without showing favoritism or prejudice
examples: She maintained a balanced diet with proper nutrition
The gymnast performed perfectly balanced routines
The news report provided a balanced view of events
He gave a balanced assessment of both proposals

definitions: having little or no hair on the scalp or body surface
stated plainly without attempt to elaborate or soften the message
examples: His bald head gleamed under the bright lights
The eagle's distinctive bald head identifies the species
That's a bald lie with no truth whatsoever
She made a bald statement of the facts

definitions: in the process of becoming bald through gradual hair loss
examples: The balding man considered various hair restoration options
He noticed his balding crown in recent photos

definitions: connected with the science of projectiles and their flight path
becoming furiously angry in an uncontrolled way like an explosion
examples: The military tested new ballistic missile defense systems
Scientists calculated the ballistic trajectory of the rocket
He went ballistic when he discovered the damage
The coach went ballistic over the referee's call
